msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.l: If there is a strife between men, and they approachthe court, and the judges judge them, and they justifythe righteous and convict thefaulty:
And it shall be, if thewicked man is to be beaten, that the judge shall cause him to falland to be beaten before him,according to his wickedness in number.
Forty timeshe shall strike him. And he shall not add, lest, in case he would go on to beathim with more beating than this, your brother become despisedin your eyes.
You shall not muzzlethe cattle when it treads out the grain.

Ifbrothers live together, and one of them dies andhas no child, the wife of the dead |man| shall not befor a stranger, outside. His close relative shall come to her and take herto him for a wife and be close to her.
And it shall be, that the firstborn that she bears shall stand over the nameof his brother who is dead, that his name be not blotted outof Israel.

And if the man does not want to takehis close |relative|, then his close |relative| shall go to the court of justiceto the elders, and say, “My close |relative| does not want to preservea name for his brother in Israel. He is not willing to be closeto me.”
Then the elders of his city shall call him,and they shall speak to him, and if he stands and says,“I do not want to take her,”

Then his close |relative| shall approachhim in the sight of the elders and pull his shoeoff his foot, and she shall spit beforehim. And shall begin and say, “So shall it be done to that man who does not build uphis brother’s house.”
And his name shall be calledin Israel Beit-Halutz-Hannaal.

Whenmen fight together, a man and his brother, andthe wife of the one draws near to rescue her husbandfrom the hand of the one striking him and reaches out her hand and takes holdof his private parts,
Then you shall cut off her hand,your eye shall not pity her.
You shall not havein your bag a great silver measure and a small silvermeasure.
You shall not have in your housea great grain measure and a small grain measure.
You shall have a perfect and just silver measure,you shall have a perfect and just grain measure, sothat your days may be prolonged on the land which the Lordyour God is giving you.
Because everyone who does such things is an abominationto the Lord your God, everyone who doeswickedness.
Remember what Amalek did to youon the way when you came out from Egypt,
That he met youon the way and attacked from behind all feeble ones among youat your rear, and you were exhausted and tired, andhe did not fear God.

So it shall be,when the Lord your God will give you rest from all your enemies all aroundin the land which the Lord your God is giving you for an inheritanceto inherit it, you shall blot out the remembrance of Amalekfrom under heaven. You shall not forget.

app.note: Heb. בֵּית חֲלוּץ הַנָּעַל ‘the house of the one whose shoe was taken off’.
